intro: Lathyrus tingitanus f. granatensis, commonly known as the Granada larkspur, is a botanical variant of the species Lathyrus tingitanus. It is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of pinnate leaves, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
